Question: How to get the first element of the List or Set?: :This question already has answers here:                                                            Java: Get first item from a collection                                (14 answers)                            Closed 4 years ago.I'd like to know if I can get the first element of a list or set. Answer:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>:
Iterator<String> iterator = list.iterator();
String first = iterator.next();
<<<explanation>>>:
The Iterator.next() method returns the next element in the iteration.

A: I'm not sure what you mean by "which method to use".  If you want to get the first element of a list, you can use List.get(int index) or List.get(int index).  If you want to get the first element of a set, you can use Set.iterator().next().

A: You can use List.get(int index) to get the first element of a list.
You can use Set.iterator().next() to get the first element of a set.
